I just got back from seeing Harry Potter and I must say...what an improvement!  The acting was better, the graphics were better and the new additions of Kenneth Branagh as Gilderoy Lockhart and Jason Issacs as Lucius Malfoy...what casting!  I didn't know until this morning that he was playing Draco dad's and as soon as I realized, well anyone that saw him in the Patriot knows why.

I think that chamber of secrets is better than the first Harry Potter movie. It's a lot more "scary" scenes in it, which makes it less suitable for children, but on the other hand it now reaches a larger group of audience. You shall not forget that it's script is taken from the book, so maybe it comes naturally that it is more violent.

Harry Potter made a good book series.  I found the movies to be good adaptations of the books.  The first movie was excellent.  I find Chamber of Secrets to be a good stand alone film that keeps the series alive as well. Truly an enjoyable film.  I hope they manage to make a third film a reality.

hmmmm is that a movie adressed to children?? Well i dont consider my self as the sensitive type, dont have kids and i like movies of tarantino type, buuutt i found this movie to be awfull for kids. Voices shouting i want blood, i want to kill, an elf that hits itself all the time, banging his head on everything, scary snakes, killing, hanging cats, bloody messages on the wall, words kill and death been said to the movie like a 100 times, i mean what did this movie offer to children??? It was just too dark and with awfull scenes. If i had a small kid i would never allow to see this! As for the plot it was boring, i lost interest very fast, not amusing at all, not a single joke in it to lighten things up(though kenneth tried to bring some comic relief but it wasnt enough). Poter 1 was way better than this one.

i just came from an advanced preview of the new harry potter film 40 mins ago and i was quite pleased. The acting, story (and the fact that it stuck close to the book and the directing were all very good. However there was somthing about the film that didnt quite grip me in the way that the philosophers stone did.

I went to see this the day it came out, with some trepidation. As an Englishman living in Canada and having a Foster daughter who is fed up with me telling her how good British Movies are - this one had a lot to live up to. We have read all the books and await the next book with eager anticipation. I went to the local Cinema (sorry - Movie Theatre) and it was packed with mostly young teens and pre-teenagers. They all sat still and maintained their interest for 2 hours 41 minutes (was it really that long?). Many jumped at the frightening parts and many laughed at the funny parts (me loudest of all). There just wasn't enough of Hagrid and poor old Albus (Richard Harris)was showing that his illness was more serious than the last film - but we all loved the film and were talking about the good bits as we left the theatre. Some achievement! To translate the books and to keep the magic must be difficult but it succeeds. The film was slightly over-long and we were suffering from some discomfort because our seats weren't the best, and the ending was a bit of an anti-climax (should have had more humour, I think) - but - whatever. This is one for the kid in all of us. Get out there and see it.

Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets is an enormous improvement on the first film, which i must admit i am not a big fan of. Everything is much better the second time around. The 3 actors have settled into their roles (Emily Watson standing out), the visual effects improved (the fantastic Basilisk, Dobby, and Quidditch match), better editing, a more involving musical score, and an overall much funnier screenplay (Kenneth Branagh had me in stitches).
I'm sorry if this gets lengthy.

This movie was totally amazing!!!! I actually read the book 5 times, so I knew what was going to happen, but I still loved it! It was really scary at times, even for me (I'm a horror movie fanatic). I was sitting in the 2nd row from the front (every other spot was taken) with my friend, and I'm telling you, it's really creepy the way things just jump out at you when you're that close to the screen!! But anyhoo, it was better than the first....it was scarier, funnier, and more action packed!! If you haven't seen it yet, I recommend you go TODAY!! (or whenever you have time)Keep in mind, though, that if you're going to bring your kids, make sure they know that it might scare them. Cause it most likely will.

I was not a fan of the first film (Philosopher's/ Sorcerer's/ Whoever's Stone), so it was lucky that I did get to see this next instalment. The various magical goings on have been integrated into the story rather than presented as the special effects guy's CV and the performances are good rather than tolerable. The three juvenile leads have really found their roles this time round (Daniel Radcliffe seems to have a particular talent for interacting with CGI) and should be easier for children to identify with while CoS is also a lot funnier than SS, especially the Kenneth Branagh performance as Gilderoy Lockhart. Although in comparison to Lord of the Rings the mysterious, magical world is still a little "normal" (and too concerned with presenting sorcerous versions of real world objects and institutions), there's sufficient innovation and genuine darkness to feel you are watching a fantasy film. Well worth seeing; enough spectacle for children and enough interest for adults.

I think Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets is excellent!  Although the first was very good, this one is much better because all the actors are growing both physically and as actors.  I must admit that Dan Radcliff could look a bit more convincing about being in pain...but, all in all, it's a wonderful movie not only for children, but for the rest of the world as well.  If you love the books you will definitely love the movie.  If you haven't read the books, you're missing out but you'll still see a great movie.  It will make you laugh, make you cry, make you scared, and best of all, it'll make you want to tell everyone you know to go see it so they can enjoy it as well.

I just saw this film and I loved it. It's really great for kids and adults, all my family loved it. Daniel Radcliffe's acting really was amazing and he's only a kid and he carries the whole film. Emma Watson was classy and Kenneth Branagh was great with the kids. :) 10 out of 10, must see!

If you have no interest in Harry Potter you need to have you're brain checked out 'cause there's no way on earth that you can be disappointed with the film 'Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets'!!! Some people refused to watch the 2nd Harry Potter movie because the first film (lets face it) did have rubbish acting in it. but this is a million times better. There's no way that I'm waiting until June 2004 for the 3rd movie!!!

Words cannot even begin to describe the excitement I was feeling when the day of November 15th slowly drew near.  The first movie was simply amazing, and trusting in Chris Columbus, I knew that the second movie was going to be even better than the previous.  And boy, let me say it was.

And why do I think it is? Well 4 starters, the first movie was good. I must say that the writer of the novel together with the film crew has created a marvelous world 4 wizards and witches 2 live in. But the second movie, the one about the secret chamber, it has a depth that you very seldom come across when it comes 2 "child-movies".

I don't know if this was posted before, but in this movie we learn that Salazar Slytherin was very particular about the students that he wanted "only pure bloods in Hogwarts", but when Harry enters the chamber of secrets and finds Tom Riddle and he describes himself as Lord Voldemort he specifically said "Surely I wasn't going to keep my filthy muggle mother's name" so that means that Lord Voldemort is not a pure blood, that he is a muggle himself, maybe he really wasn't the true heir of Salazar Slytherin, maybe he performs a spell or a curse on the basilisk so that he can controlled it. So who really was the true heir of Salazar Slytherin I just hope that since harry can speak parcel tong that he isn't the heir of Slytherin and that is what Harry Potter is. Also in the book of JK Rolling they talk about the prophecy of a boy or something like that maybe the prophecy talks about that Harry Potter is the heir of Salazar Slytherin and is related to Lord Voldemort I just hope that is not true. What do you all think?

as this is my 1st review, it just had to be the harry potter series. the best movie series ever been created. i grew up watching this movies and the chambers of secrets is the only i can watch a 1000 times and still never get bored. of all the series these would be the ratings according to me : 1.chamber of secrets 2.half blood prince 3.sorcerer's stone 4.half blood prince 5.deathly hallows 2 6.order of Phoenix 7.deathly hallows 1 8.prisoner of azkaban
I loved PS when it came out. It became one of my favourite movies. Then Chamber of Secrets came out. My first impression was, that it didn't live up to the first movie.
These spoilers are from the Scorcerer's Stone + Chamber of Secrets (the books, not the movies!)
Amazing movie. Beautifully adopted the character, cinematography, story acting Every field this is a masterpiece.

Now this was an excellent movie.  I wasn't particularly impressed with the first film where I was left thinking, "is that it"!  The second film however has changed my view completely.  The ending was good but missed the "extra treat" that was mentioned in the reviews because I didn't wait until the end credits were over - didn't read the reviews before watching the film!  The film had a lot of hilarious scenes.  I didn't realise it was a three hour film until the film was over and I looked at the watch!  So, don't be put off by the length of the film - you won't feel the time pass by!  If you like this type of films, then this is definitely one to watch!

I LOVED this movie !!!! it was a good as the first one if not better, it had all the elements, scary , funny , sad... and the actors did a Great job !!! it was super !!! and i fully intend on seeing it again and purchasing the tape when it becomes available to buy ,i proudly own the first movie in the series....
The Good: Kenneth Branagh (stole every scene he was in), the plot.

This movie is the perfect follow-up to "Sorcerer's Stone."  The students continue to be charmingly engaging and the special effects are great! Both movies are faithful to the books, which is very satisfying to all of us who love the HP series, but the movies hold together on their own quite well. Kenneth Branagh is a hoot as the ridiculously pompous teacher Gilderoy Lockhart.  And, if you're a credits fan like I am, stick around until the very end when there's a little extra treat in store.

The film was fantastic!  The kids have really come into their own and are truly actors.  Daniel Radcliffe (Harry), Emma Watson (Hermione) and Rupert Grint (Ron) give us a blockbuster performance.  They are not just good because they are kids, but they give true performances.  This film has much more special effects, done extremely well compared to the first film. This makes the Quidditch match even more entertaining and realistic.  It takes the film to an entirely different level. The film once again is 2:30, however, it felt MUCH MUCH shorter than that.  If you have not read the second book, please be aware that the storyline does become darker, scarier if you wish.  If you have never read or seen the first movie/book, I highly recommend that you do so, as this film jumps right into the action, and you have very little history of the characters.  If you do not know the background, you will easily be confused.

The only reason the first Harry Potter movie may be better is because it was the opener to the series and therefore more magical and new.  This new one offers everything the first did AND more (especially in the climax), but as much new stuff as there is, some of it is still just more of the 1st movie.  It is another episode into the story, so we revisit things from the 1st movie, whether this is good or bad is up to the viewer.  The kids are all great, the teachers are all great, and the action sequences are all great.  10 out of 10
Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets. A Review by Joseph Gibson.

972/5000

After the first hour my vote already drops to 5.4

Flaws:

1) How did Ron know about the bars in Harry's bedroom window? He immediately proceeded to pull out a kind of hook to detach the bars. I know you'll say "It's magic, what do you expect?" Yes, but for the sake of the film, he could have said something like "Hey Harry, we've been watching you without getting caught in these months ..."

2) And it was not explained how Harry had the suitcase ready at that exact moment. "Magic, dude", all right but Logically, he would have already prepared it because he was trembling at the idea of returning to Hogwarts, but I'm still not sure, he doesn't even mention it ...

3) Harry Potter ends up in Diagonally and what do the Weasleys do? they leave him defenseless, without protecting him.

But luckily he meets Hagrid, and this saved him from the dangerous people around Diagonally. Very very dangerous.

4) Ron and Harry have to take the train, and they are late. Since the wall is impenetrable, they lose the train. The demented Ron is convinced that his parents will never return, so what does he do? The right thing to do is to use the car and fly with Harry to Hogwarts. Are you serious? But also Harry, why does he let Ron do that, when both are only 12 years old? his head doesn't seem to work sometimes. I'd forgive this huge mistake of using the flying car if they were influenced by Dobby, but the elf never mentioned it. Can you ever imagine the reaction of Ron's parents? When they say goodbye to the children and see the train disappear, and go back to the station parking lot and then notice that they are left without a car?

5) As soon as they arrive to Hogwarts, the car starts to mumble and ends up on a giant tree, this tree is deadly and furious and would have killed them and destroyed the car in a flash. Ron and Harry survive, the car is in pitiful condition now. The car at a certain point, after the impact, drives off into the forest, without a driver. Wait a second, why couldn't the magic car get away from the tree first and save two children from certain death? Or maybe it was Dobby the driver? I don't know, I'm confused ...

6) The Herbology professor who tells the children after Neville Longbottom's fainting something like "Just leave him there". Seriously? It's funny though.

7) I would have liked to see the sorting of Ginny since she is an important character in the film.

8) But what happened to the first lesson of Gilderoy? As a coward, this teacher runs away leaving the children in danger. Not a big deal, in fact Hermione saves everyone with a spell. What a child prodigy, really. But everything that happened in that class is still serious. Neville was hung several meters high. We don't know what happened next, like how the other teachers reacted? Would Lockart hide everything from the other teachers? I have no idea...

9) The school is incredibly big. But somehow, the whole school meets the trio right in front of the crime scene "The chamber of secrets has been opened. Enemies of the heir, beware"I don't really buy that.

10) Why didn't the more experienced wizards stop the crazy ball during the Quidditch game? Hermione hinted that it would be dangerous to do so, to stop the ball, for the risk of accidentally hitting Harry. The most powerful sorcerers in the audience would have had no problem stopping a crazy ball. But finally, Hermione destroys the ball. Again, what a child prodigy.

I have read the first two books and seen the movies. The first book was a great story, a non-superhero could handle an end-of-the-world-will-come situation in a kinda non-violent manner. It was modern, fast-paced, could compete with any action movie and still something good for the children (and for us, too).

I watched it like 45 times and i don't know why i watch it again and again. It has a very rich story in it. Yeah, obviously it has a rich story and we all know about. If you haven't watched this movie, oh man..what where you doing.

My brother bribed me to see this movie and I said okay, even though I hated the first one.  What do I have to say?  The acting was pretty good and the sfx were okay, but the story lacked. **SPOILERS AHEAD**

If you were looking for a movie which dug deep into the history and legend of Hogwarts then you should look no further!! The Chamber of Secrets makes the audience know how deep the Harry Potter universe is and all the things within. it also had a good flavour to it which will make you watch this movie once you have started watching it and will surely make you a Potterhead if you love the magical world, very less movies are out there which are as perfect and as good as this one.
I guess we all know the feeling. After a successful movie, the sequel always meets very high expectations, and almost never live up to them.

First movie was better, this one still holds up. Maybe I am biased because I listend to the audiobook first so the first movie was exciting to watch because it was the first visual expierence I had after knowing the story from the audiobooks. Long story short, the first half of the movie was fun but the second half felt weak and the story was kinda confusing. At some point I wasn't quite sure if Voldemort was acutally Voldemort or not. The finale didn't do justice to the whole build-up.

This had to be the worst film I have ever seen at the cinema. I can't believe how weak this film was. A few friends and I decided to catch the late showing of the film as to avoid the crowds. The show started at 10......we left the cinema at 1am feeling bored, let down and very very tired. The acting was pathetic, Daniel Radcliffe (Harry Potter) is obviously getting worse with age. The first film he entertain and was easy to watch. But his performance in the Chamber of Secrets was thin and was barely held up by other cast members. The story is all over the place, going of in different directions and then bouncing back without conclusion to that particular thred. Immensely boring, badly acted and badly directed. I want my £5.20 back please. Lastly, Robbie Coltrane, what has happened to you. You were once a great actor. Go back to being cracker, it's better than being a giant hairy fool who looks up to half a**ed wizard ! James.

"Chamber Of Secrets" continues pretty much where "Philosopher's Stone" left off. Hence we don't get the long character introductions, and are thrown straight into the action. Although not perfectly true to the book in every respect (key lines are transposed from one character to another; key events are lost or misplaced), it's a pretty faithful representation.
DETAIL SPOILERS TO FOLLOW - NO PLOT SPOILERS TO ANY WHO'VE READ THE NOVEL

This very enjoyable movie is actually even better than the first movie of the series.  All of the actors, especially the three young stars, (Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson and Rupert Grint) at the center of the film are obviously more comfortable in their roles as Harry Potter, Hermione Granger and Ron Weasley, respectively.  The story adheres as closely as possible to the wonderfully written book by J.K. Rowling.  While some of the details and events in the book were omitted and several separate scenes in the book were combined into one or two scenes, the true heart and hero of this particular story, Harry Potter, was nicely translated to the screen (and excellently played by Daniel Radcliffe, too.) The sets and special effects were well-done and greatly added to the I-so-wish-this-could-be-a-real-world feel and charm of the movie.   A charming movie that I highly recommend to anyone who wants to feel like a kid again while sitting in the theater!
Bruh this movie be making me simp for young voldy.

I didn't much like the second Harry Potter movie. I think the blame lies squarely with Chris Columbus; Alfonso Cuaron should do a much better job with the next movie. Columbus never builds tension into his shots by holding them longer than necessary to communicate a plot point. His camera angles never seem to do more than tell a direct narrative. Unlike plays, movies can force the audience to view the actors according to the very specific intentions of the director, accomplished by the angle, the lens, lighting, etc. Columbus does this somewhat, but not enough.

I have read the book as well as seen the movie and i think both are very good in there own right.... The book as more to it and gives you more information...while the film on the other hand gives all the information in a smaller space of time and doesn't explain every detail from the first movie as well as explaining it further if that make sense... Daniel is brilliant as ever playing Harry. and hopefully will carry on to do so in the rest of the films....his chemistry/friendship with Rupert and Emma is shown on screen and off. I cant wait for film 3 and 4 to come out...i have read the books and would like to see the out come of the film...what bits are missing and also if they have added anything which makes the film more funny/different to the books....i have to admit that when harry potter 1st came out in 2001 i wasn't bothered about it..but someone advised me to read the 1st book which i got as a present because they told me that i would enjoy both the book and the film and i haven't looked back since now i just cant wait for the next..... i give the film and the book 10/10

Hey people, See This Movie!!!!! It's Great, i mean i know  it doesn't follow the book fully but it is very close to it. The special effects are great, the actors are better than the first one, its just so much better. I liked how Draco is meaner i love him all together

I just watched the movie and I thought it was going well until the showdown. I suppose they just moved too fast.  Everything led up to this moment and it just didn't happen; or didn't happen very well.  But I love the storyline and the fact that they explain why certain events were shown so you don't think there is no reason for it.  Also, I would like to express my admiration for Ms. Rowling; she managed to get an entire generation interested in reading in these times where it is practically a force of nature to plop down in front of the TV or computer.  I wasn't even possitive my own sister could read until she came home one day with HP books in her arms and rambled on and on about them.  I almost cried... I need a moment...;)

After watching `The chamber of secrets' I made a determination to myself: I will definitely go back and watch the next film, not only because this one is a pretty decent sequel to first film, it's because I think that Alfonso Cuaron will make a wonderful work. This film is as fresh and funny as the first one and the visual effects are so much better, the characters and the acting still goes strong and it's funnier than the sorcerer's stone, the only thing that I really hate about this one is the so CORNY last scene, everyone cheering for the Robbie Coltrane's character is just awful, it had nothing to do with anything! Forgetting that scene the film is in some ways better than the 1st one and I really enjoyed it!

The second movie of the Harry Potter series taking you to the fantastic world of Hogwarts, i love it.it Even though many exiting plots were deleted while filming it is still a classical movie which is significant to see. This film is quite scary actually,Potter accidentally got the diary of Tom Riddle by the meantime finding himself as parseltongue which made him doubt himself of choosing to be a Gryffindor last year. This is a gothic film, odd people,a castle full of unknown secrets and secret creatures were all combined in this film. Watching it is a great film for adventurous audiences like me.

Go and see it if you haven't already.  This is one of the films that I will be watching many times.  Daniel Radcliffe is excellent!  That goes for Rupert Grint and Emma Watson too.  To be able to enjoy it you have to get really into it and pretend you are in a real world of magic.  Having seen the first film will sure help you to like this one.

The film has been (finally !) released in France today... Fan of Mrs. Rowling's books, I just came from the theater and I'm really not disappointed !! Chris Columbus has done an amazing work. The movie is very faithful to the book. Of course, some details aren't in the movie BUT the essential is here. All the fans can't complain !! This film couldn't be better. Another thing to notice is the HUGE talent of the entire cast of the movie. Daniel Radcliffe (oh my god this little boy has so much talent !), Rupert Grint and Emma Watson are completely fantastic... They've really grown up ! Tom Felton (Draco), Jason Issacs (Lucius Malfoy), Kenneth Branagh (Gilderoy Lockhart), Alan Rickman (Snape), Robbie Coltrane (Hagrid), Richard Harris (Dumbledore)... had made a great work too. They really know how to play the fabulous characters at Hogwarts. But, the most surprising was -for me- Christian Coulson, who was so amazing as Tom Marvolo Riddle.

A lot of magic, sweetened with a budding romance, spiced with humour, then a bit of suspense...same ingredients as the first movie but this time blended with craft and intelligence. This is one movie that works in almost anyway you see it.

Nice and entertaining movie, a must see because of the charming story. Even though this movie is full of special effects, you really ought to see it because of the story. A wonderfully innocent plotline. There should be more movies like this.

The movie was brilliant and if you don't enjoy it, nothing can please you. I was surprised how great it was. It still followed the book fairly well and yet threw in little surprises of there own. Thats what makes a book/ movie brilliant. The special effects have upgraded from the lousy Troll in the first one to an absolutely spectacular Basilisk at the end of the movie. The humour was ten times better than the first and the acting was absolutely extrordinary. Chris Columbus did a marvelous job and I for one think he shouldn't resign. However time goes on and we'll just have to wait to see what Alfonso gives us fro The Prisoner of Azkaban.

I'm really really disappointed with this 2nd installment of Harry Potter's adventure. Back then when the 1st Harry Potter movie was released, I am so eager to see it. And while I can't also said perfect for HP & The Sorcerer's Stone, it's still way way better than the successor. The adaptation from the novel is awful. I don't know what's wrong with it. It's almost exactly the perfect copy of the novel, everything.      (Could it be this is where the problem is? Movies have their own formula). Almost every scene in the novel are there, but something's missing. I don't know. I just can't feel the passion I used to feel when watching a great movie. Not that it's completely crap. The ultimate casting  is the soul of this film, isn't it? Casting, art direction, Sp. effects, and all that stuff is placed very brilliantly by the producers, directores & all film concerns. But..... Where is the Soul which met me in the Novel? Where is that Soul of the novel which came from directly by the heart(through brain) of J. K. Rowling? Well leave it. Daniel Radcliffe,Rupert Grint,Emma Watson gives us the exact characters of Harry, Ron & Hermione respectively. They are marvelous! What i like most in this film are voice of Dumbledore, smile of MacGonagall & Hagrid's Hut!

Direction was better, acting was better, special effects were better than the first.Funny thing about expectations is that they are often wrong. I expected the Sorcerer's Stone to be great because of all the hype. I was bored. It was very disappointing. I go to the Chamber of secrets expecting another lackluster,less than state of the art special effects,run of the mill B movie and again I'm wrong. From beginning to end the movie had my full attention. It's one of those flicks that the smell of fresh popcorn,wafting with the fragrance of melted butter won't get me out of my seat because I didn't want to miss a single scene. That's big in my ratings book. The fist Harry Potter I think I went out to blow my nose. I just didn't care what happened next. Watching Secrets I couldn't wait for the next scene. Big difference in how good a movie is. I must tell you that I have never read any of the Potter books so I don't know how true the movies relate. I felt that I didn't waste $8.75. If you have some time on your hands go see this one. It's worth it.

The excitement dripping from my frosty autumn bum as I rushed in to find a seat at the latest Harry Potter installment, I found myself gleefully following along with the whimsical Williams trademark theme that chimed over the sound system as I sat down. I was excited at the possibilities and potentials this movie could deliver, and thirsty for the magic. The movie starts off promising enough, I was glad to be taken a little deeper into the world of magic that everyday wizards and witches use as we hang out with the Weasley's for a spell. But once at school, there is much the movie tries to accomplish, and it begins to crush under the weight of it's own ambitions (or the ambition of  Warner Bros). Kenneth Branaugh gives a delightful performance, as does the other heavy weights (Harris, Smith, Rickman, and the other elders) as usual. But I felt no connection to Harry. No sense of his struggles or his accomplishments. Rather I felt as if Harry was an empty vessel that was only the carrier of a great magic, not a great magician himself. The protagonists (even young Draco Malfoy) were all much more colorful and interesting characters than the fish eyed little good magicians running around with tears in there eyes and "we shouldn't be doing this Harry" look on their faces. I think the studios did a good job of casting and directing the villains, but can't we give some more life to the hero(s)? My next gripe is the music. Was John Williams not interested because the caliber of movie was significantly lower than the first? Was he too busy? Could they not afford him because they spent their budget on effects, yet couldn't even afford all the effects they wanted? (i.e- the phoenix reminded me of a stuffed robotic parrot my grandma keeps in the kitchen that repeats what you say while flapping it's wings and moving it's beak). The music that was "adapted" was a bit bludgeoning: all I could think of was the original scenes from the first movie they were taken from. The new cues (synth pads and "spooky" atmospherics) were a bit lifeless and repetitive. Could we not get anyone to write new music, people? The last half hour all I could think was "Scooby Doo...Scooby Doo...Scooby Doo". Now I have to sit here and watch all the loose ends tie up and come together while the evil plot is explained with painstaking detail by the recently exposed villain mastermind. Then the addendum -glee overload- when all at Hogwart's returned back to normal and cries of joyous triumph filled the air, the theater filled me with the stale stench of a sickeningly tidy little perfect package that didn't leave me with much inspiration or magic at all. I can only hope "Chamber..." does poorly enough at the box office that the producers learn to take a little more time and care with the next one. Don't rush it too much fellas...you'll go so fast you miss the magic.

I am a HUGE fan of Harry Potter, I've read all the books and I love 'em all! I've seen the first Potter-movie, and it isn't as good as The Chambers of secrets. It was so... I don't really even know what word I'm looking for. It was amazing. I mean, it was a once-in-a-lifetime thing. -Although I'm going to see it a second time. :) Everybody who loves a action, fantasy or adventure movie, or simply is a HARRY POTTER-fan will LOVE IT!!! + The effects are AWSOME!!! A Potter fan or not, you're still going to LOVE IT!!!!

I saw the movie last week after having read the second book again before I went to watch. I don't recommend this to anyone because you can remember very well what has been left out of the book. I think the second book is definitly better than the first one but the third and fourth are even better... It could have been a more exciting and thrilling movie if they followed the storyline better. Some crucial parts are left out. You can't feel how agonising life at 4, Privet Drive is. If you read the book you are ready to jump in and rescue poor Harry. The Weasly's however are magnificent. A movie you can't miss, but it could have been better!!!

The Harry Potter phenomenon, I admit, it is one thing I do not quite understand. Neither groundbreaking or unique, the stories have struck a cord with a large audience and this is translated from the books to the screen. The canon is, for want of a better word, 'nice'. It's quite under-whelming, forgetful nonsense that would be an attractive notion to gather round the hearth of a nice fire on a Sunday eve and watch as a handsomely produced television series.

I saw this film at the first available public filming this morning at 10:00 am. I just had to be the first one there because I was so excited. I knew it was going to be awesome. Well, it lived up to my expectations. It was defiantly my favorite movie. And not just of the two, but of all of the movies I have seen. And I have seen a lot of movies. I think that the special effects were better, as everyone has said. And I think that the characters were more intense, as well as the scenes. As was the dialogue. It follows along with the book very well. It doesn't actually change anything, it just leaves some things out. I thought it was scarier and it made me cringe, you'll see when you see it. Anyway, it's great I love it, you should see it , take you friends and you family, gosh it's great!

Well, it lived up to my expectations. It was defiantly my favorite movie. And not just of the two, but of all of the movies I have seen. And I have seen a lot of movies. I think that the special effects were better, as everyone has said. And I think that the characters were more intense, as well as the scenes. As was the dialogue. I'm far from the target audience for HP and the Chamber of Secrets (I'm 21 years old) and I didn't enjoy the first movie of the series as much as I thought I would - having read all the books more than three times each, my hopes were really high and I was disappointed with the whole thing from the first minute.

Being a huge fan of the Harry Potter books, it's so great to be able to see them come to life on the screen. And although I did think at first that my own image of the books might be destroyed by an unworthy actor's portrayal, the movies made so far have been alarmingly close to what I'd imagined the books to be like. So, it was great when I went to the theater with the expectations of the first movie, only to be shocked that the second movie has out done my expectations. We can only hope that when the reins are handed over to another director that the finished product will live up to its predecessors. Although I am over twenty, I must admit to being an unabashed reader of the Harry Potter books. I really hope that the next five movies to be made will be as true to J.K. Rowling's books as the first two have. If you love the books, you have to SEE THIS MOVIE!! (I only have one complaint...where's peeves?)

No one will be disappointed with the second film of the Harry Potter movies. Avid readers of the books will easily be able to pick out what was left out and altered, but being able to see things such as the Burrow, the Mandrakes, Dumbledore's Office, and Fawkes is truly wonderful!  The characters are all much more developed and well acted.  The spiders and the Basilisk are a bit scary for the younger viewer.  All in all, Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets definitely delivers!

Originally, I saw the first film, Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, expecting nothing but a trailer for the new Star Wars film, and a kids film. It wasn't nearly as bad, I must admit, as I had in preconception. So I was curious to see Chris Columbus pull a "Home Alone 2" and ruin the sequel completely... I was dead wrong. This is a very interesting, much more entertaining and much darker film than its predecessor. I would go see it again, as a matter of fact. Now that is terrifying...kids movies are...actually REALLY GOOD movies in their own right? Yikes.

i dont know about anyone else who saw Harry Potter, but i thought it was a lot like the other one, all of the same conflicts occurred, through the quittage, malfoy and even valdamort, basically the same conflicts arose only around a much darker story, which is the only thing i did like.  Harry Potter bored me to death, it would not get to the point, there were at least a dozen scenes that were just pointless and were put in just to please those who are sticklers about book movies. It seems to me, that Mr Potter is not a really great wizard, all of the situations that put him in perilous danger he is helped by others or by some odd coincidence. **SPOILERS** My easiest example about this would obviously be the scene with the spiders about to pounce on Harry and his friend, the car just come out of no where and saves them, even after spitting them out in disgust for whatever reason.  Also when hes fighting the snake the phionex comes out of nowhere and gives him this sword that has no explanation of its signifigance, and when he DOES kill the snake its a total luck shot, all he did was hold it up and the thing did the rest for him. But dont get me wrong i did sort of enjoy this movie, when i wasnt bored, pointing out the ridiculusly predictable plot line, or just flat out screaming for it to end.

Simply put, Sorcerors Stone was a much more moral movie, yes, but the beauty of Chamber of Secrets is that it tackles issues rather than morals.  It does this in a way that you have to be paying attention to realize.  The strain between the Pure Bloods and the Muggle born children, that's as close as you can get to discussing racism without shoving it down a child's throat.  More people should think to utilize a child's perception of good and evil in order to show how the world can (but does not have to be) a bad place. The Chamber of Secrets can be at times, violent, and I certainly would have had nightmares if I was say, five to ten years old, but truthfully, the movies I remember most fondly as a child scared me, such as The Dark Crystal, or The Goonies.
Some will argue that the first film was better. More will argue that this, the second outing of J.K.Rowling's immensely popular novels was better.

Harry Potter and the chamber of secrets - the much anticipated sequel to the 2001 blockbuster Harry Potter and the philosophers stone, in my view, is exceptionally better; better in every department, compared to the last one.

I hated Harry Potter, but when I went to see the movie I just fell in love with it. I have read the book five times each, I have seen the movie about eight or nine times, and my room is literally filed with HP merchandise. This movie is such a compelling story full of mystery and excitement. The story starts as always, when Harry is with his aunt and uncle. He feels traped (which he later is by his uncle) because he has not recieved letters from his friends and is still treated badly by his own blood-family he has. When Dobby, a house elf, shows up in his room and warns him not to return to Howgarts, that a terror has been unleashed on mudbloods (muggle born). Harry ignores these warnings and returns to Howgarts, just to discover that a monster has been petrifing mudbloods throughout the year. When all the clues start adding up, it is up to Ron and Harry to capture the monster, bring Hagrid back, and get rid of all the rumors and evil that has been circling around his life. These is a story which all kids around the world will enjoy and cherish for decades to come. I gave this movie a 10 out of 10.

This was better than Sorcerer's/Philosopher's stone by far. Gone are the painful introductions of the first film, and now we just have the definately improved acting skills of the kids from one film to the next. Rupert, Daniel, and Emma are all great talents, and the Warners and Columbus are lucky to have them.

A must see!!!! Awesome!!! Coolest movie!! Best of the Best! Incredible!! Amazing!!! Awesome!! THE BEST MOVIE IN THE WORLD! NO ONE CAN BEAT THIS MOVIE!!!

This movie ROCKS !!!! i just Loved it !!  i was a non Harry Potter fan, before the first movie, i hadn't even read any of the books and yet i loved it !! lots of action and excitement, and especially in the second one, lots of creepy parts .. it was well acted and i fully intend to buy the video , and i own the first one , and look forward to seeing the next installment , its a definite good time for all the family !! it totally deserves the 10/10 !!!

***SPOILERS***   ***SPOILERS*** I found this movie to be quite enjoyable despite the lack of effort from Daniel Radcliffes preformance. I think he preformed terribley as Harry and is the worst actor ever. The film (like the book) was well written and the twist at the end was very cool (I mean TOM MARVOLO RIDDLE being an anigram for I AM LORD VOLDEMORT) nobody saw that coming. Daniel Radcliffe came back and again made all us kids salivate. Rupert Grint makes us laugh even harder and Emma Watson makes you want to cry. All the actors did an excellent job. 10/10 for acting, 10/10 for words!

Quite honestly, this has been one of the worst book adaptations I have ever seen.  Granted, I haven't seen many, but it's the principle of things. I'm ever so glad that Columbus is not directing the 3rd installment of the HP series.  The imagery is nice and Chris Coulson is hot, so maybe that's the only good thing about this movie, well that and Professor Snape.  If you feel like wasting nearly three hours of your life, I'd recommend reading the book instead of seeing this movie.
I had really high hopes for Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets as well as for the first one.
Chamber of Secrets is by far the best movie of the famed Harry Potter series. It depicts Hogwarts in its best form and majesty. PoA is not even half of it.

The first Harry Potter movie broke some big records and started one of the biggest and beloved film franchise of all time. And this movie improved almost on everything the first gave us. In this movie you can clearly see that the main cast is transforming into great actors. Daniel, Emma and Rupert are really good in this movie, and so is the supporting cast too. The great new addition comes in the form of Kenneth Branagh who plays Professor Gilderoy Lockhart. He is one of the highlights in this movie, and is a great comedic element in it. He steals every scene he is in it. He's such a disgusting character but you cannot help yourself, and love that brilliant character. The story is more mature than in the first movie. I would call the movie a horror movie for children. There's a lot of twist and turns that keep you entertaining through this very long movie. And this is the longest of the Harry Potter movies, clocking at 161 minute. But you don't feel it, every minute is entertaining. The story is really well done, wrapped with suspense, adventure and mystery. The negativities I had in the first movie (little bit of 3rd act and CGI) are gone in this one. Every act in this movie is stable. The CGI is incredible improved, and not only that, but after 14 years, this movie looks absolutely incredible. The flying car scene is one of the biggest highlights of the movie. And the House Elf Dobby is incredible to look at, even in 2016. I would even dare to say this version of Dobby looks better than the Deathly Hallows one when it comes to CGI. And the final battle with the basilisk, again, firework for the eyes. This is Chris Columbus second Harry Potter movie, and the direction is, like in the first one, good. He knows what he wants. He's a great visionary director, a talent very important for a series like Harry Potter, full of CGI and action. The cinematography is improved too. This is a very good looking movie. But speaking about the technical stuff of the movie, the real winner is John Williams score. I said that the first Harry Potter movie had one of the best scores of all time, and John didn't disappoint this time either. Such a magnificent and beautiful score this is. And I have to mention this, this movie didn't get any nomination at the Oscars in 2003. This movie, without a doubt, was snubbed for Best Score and Best Visual Effects. This movie is almost without any flaws. The high quality of the movie sticks to the end. I only can recommended this movie to anyone. This is truly one of the best family movies of all time, and maybe the best Harry Potter movie too.

Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets is by far my favorite Harry Potter movie. In my opinion, it is the only one that follows the entire plot line except a few minor details. The deleted scenes add even more delicious detailing. If these scenes had been in the theatrical release the movie would have been that much better. Perhaps a reasoning behind cutting these is the movie would have been over 3 hours. Chamber of Secrets is already the longest movie in the series and to have a movie over 3 hours could make audience members' attention drift away (unless of course we're discussing Lord of the Rings or something like that). All in all, Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets is the closest movie to the plot and while many fans don't find this to be their favorite movie I deviate from the majority of the fandom.

I believe that the summery speaks for itself. If there is anything about movies that I simply can't stand, it's a movie that doesn't follow the book it is written about. And on top of that, this movie obviously allows a lot of creative license to the director, because he seems to have changed a lot. That said, it is obvious that he wants to give Harry a lot more credit then is really due him. In the books, we read about a boy trying to make it in a world he doesn't fully understand. In the movies, we see a young superman running around being rather self righteous and suffering from some sort of hero complex. If a movie is going to be the on screen version of a book, then it should remain true to the book. That may just be my opinion I guess...

Again this feels more like a kids film than other entries but there are elements working towards the darker tone of the later films. The acting has improved and some good set pieces. The final battle has some tense scenes and would have been out of place in the first.
SPOILER WARNING SPOILER WARNING

Watched the movie yesterday and was pleasantly surprised. HP-COS was much better and darker than the previous installment. The graphics and special effects were well done and the CGI character of Dobby was also interesting. I haven't read any of the Harry Potter books yet, so there was no bias or expectations before watching the movie. I can now understand its immense popularity. I find it surprising that even though the world developes technologically, at movies, we still seem to prefer our wizards and elf's and jedi's and the magical alternative universe that they dwell in. Three of last years biggest hits were based on fictional alter universes, and it looks like the same this year. And take note of the increased comic book heroes being presented and succeeding. Real world gritty movies rarely succeed these days and true stories, almost never.

If you love Harry Potter, then you'll love "Chamber of Secrets". This has always been my favorite book, and the movie doesn't let down. The story and the pacing are very close to the book. The effects work very well, and seem to be more refined than the effects in the first movie. The basilisk is without a doubt the best effect in the entire movie. I can't believe we're going to have to wait till 2004 to see "Prizoner of Azkaban". You'd better believe I'll be there on opening night! Now bring on "Order of the Phoenix"!

This movie is greater than the previous movie but there are some explanations that are not answered in this film.But the whole movie is really wonderful and its almost  same from  the book.Really great effects and all the cast are wonderful and if you watch it for the first time you feel a little weird to hear all the crack voices by Daniel and Rupert .The ending is really touchy where you can feel the true friendship between Harry, Ron and Hermione.It is a well crafted film even though it is not perfect as the book but it's better than the first.

I read all three of the books last summer and working my way through Goblet of Fire and Order of the Phoenix. In an age of science and reason, it is still great to curl up with something magical full of mystique, Sorcerer's Apprentice with Mickey Mouse, from Fantasia 2000 is still great. A person is never too old to read great literature, in fact this kind keeps the reader young.

I liked the second book and the movie more than the first, and I reread and revised them more often. After all, the first part is so "introductory" in nature, because it introduces us to the hero, his story and the magical world.

Seeing how much the first part of the young wizard's adventures earned, the producers immediately took up the second, leaving Chris Columbus as director. The decision is correct in my opinion. Let the fees have decreased, but this film has not become worse.

I've watched this movie yesterday, this movie doesn't have a strong plot in reality, if just a cheer up fan sequel type movie, hope

other sequencing movies of this series will be good.
This is definitely a pretty solid improvement over the first film and the great editing makes it so you never even realize that this goes past two and half hours.

As the movie ended I was filled with a sense of well being, Harry Potter and the chamber of Secrets is much better than the first film. Daniel Radcliffe is still finding it difficult to act naturally. Richard Harris however is his wonderful self. I was thinking these thoughts as the credits started to roll..... and then I realised that we will no longer see Richard Harris in any film or on stage again. I stayed until all the credits had gone, but no dedication (the final reel had proberly already been produced, I normally like most people stand up and walk away when the credits start, but this time I sat there till the very end, much to the annoyance of my friends, but I think we owe it to Richard Harris who disliked Harry Potter but did it wondefully none the less. Go see the film it was great (two towers will be the one to wait for however), watch the film, but as a mark of respect wait until the credits finish and remember a great talented actor.

A great film for children of all ages both big and small.The film is over two and half hours long but time seems to fly by. There are plenty of great comic moments and along with lots of exciting action scenes. My 5 year old daughter Sarah, loved the film. She clapped and cheered and was totally engrossed in the film.
The film was really enjoyable, more entertaining than the first and more of a plot line.

A little too intense for younger children, the basilisk could have been done better.  We enjoyed seeing the development of the friendship & how the characters worked together & helped each other.  The actors are very appealing ( now I can't imagine anyone else in those roles!)  The book is much better, and although they did have to squeeze a lot in , I felt that some issues were too quickly skimmed over.  Still, it's great fun & we're all going to see it again!(this review was a group effort)

3 for the special effects, otherwise totally pointless and boring movie. Holes in the plot are apparent and the movie is full of cliched Hollywood jokes. Running against the wall or hitting yourself with a lamp is supposed to be funny eh? Do yourself a favor and watch something else instead.

Ahhh!  The latest installment in Harry Potter films, and what seems to be J.K. Rowling's personal birthday gift to me. :-D I just returned from seeing this movie, and let me tell you, it is wonderful. Just got done watching the new Harry Potter movie and I thought it was great. Now I haven't read any other books but I kind of want to start into them now. Even though this maybe looked at a childrens series there is lots of stuff in it that I can love too. Now I'm not that old, only 22 but I love fantasy stuff like this. My mind starts to wander, actually my imagination starts taking over instead of reality. For those of you that liked the first movie I will believe you will enjoy this one too. Unlike most sequals I guess you could say aren't that great this one does continue the story line well but doesn't get boring or anything like that. But for those of you that have young children and are planning on taking them to this movie be warned that there are some parts that are pretty scary for a youngster. Hope this helps some of you on your decision if you will see it or not, I feel like it was worth it.

The movie was great...Not as good as the first one but it was still good. This one was longer, but it didn't feel like that. I loved all of the cool special effects and the scenery. It went from (phonetically) Guinea to Gin-knee depending on which actor said it and when they said it. I thought that was hilarious. Overall I give the movie 3.4 stars and I can't wait to see Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban.

this movie is THE BOMB. despite hearing some things about this movie being bad I enjoyed it very much. it stuck to the book like glue. I have yet to see a person who did not like this movie as much as I did.I hope you people agree.

Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets provided a very enjoyable movie-going experience.  It moved at a quicker pace than the last Harry Potter film, and kept its audience on their toes throughout the film. However, as I looked around the packed theatre and noticed several little kids, I began to wonder how this movie could be aimed at such young children.  Scenes with giant snakes and spiders, messages written with blood, and ghosts will certainly be the cause of countless nightmares. What good can come of showing little children a graphic portrayal of someone slaying a giant serpent?  Or of a floor littered with bones?  Harry Potter kept the audience entertained, but at the expense of the kids that it was supposed to be for.  Hopefully, in the next installment of this series, the producers will be reminded who their audience is - the kids - and aim the movie more towards them.
ok.  after seeing the film 3 times in the last 24 hours (beat that!), i think i can offically write a reveiw.

Arg. I was so looking forward to seeing this movie - hoping that the ineptitude displayed by Chris Columbus in the philosopher's stone would have been rectified, but I was horribly disappointed. Flashes of brilliance in cameos or effects and background details are overshadowed by poor handling of the young cast and jumpy leaps in plot. Kenneth Branagh, Mark Williams and Alan Rickman among others threaten to steal the show from the younger cast members amidst much improved special effects and scenery.

the film was amazing. infact it was even better then the last. I did not like the spiders, but that has alot to do with the fact that the graphics were so good they looked so real.(i dont like spiders) i dont know what else to say except if you have not seen it do it do it NOW.enjoy. :o)

Wow what a relief. As an avid reader of the books I was disappointed in the first film. However, Chamber of Secrets surpasses Philosophers Stone by miles, largely due to huge increase in acting ability and confidence shown by Daniel Radcliffe (Harry) and co. The screenplay is also more accomplished and funnier with less cliqued lines (although some still remain!). Kenneth Branagh is a superb Gilderoy Lockhart, oozing smarminess and vanity. Chris Columbus engineers some amazing shots in this film. The very first and the last especially stand out. Critics of the last movie said the film wasn't magical to watch, but Columbus has restored the magic in this movie. The special effects are slicker and more believable while Dobby, although not quite how I imagined him, grew on me. All in all a great cinematic experience.

I was persuaded to go to see this movie last night. Have you ever thought "Life is too short"? If so go to this movie as it will make the 2 hours 40 minutes of it's runtime seem like ten hours therefore extending the apparent span of your life. Of course another way to look at it would be that it's a waste of 160 already scarce minutes. And it's just eaten another 10 of my valuable minutes writing this!! In summary, go to see it under one of two conditions. A) you are 10 years old B) you have extreme insomnia.

A great film that exceeds the first as it is more of a movie than a straight copy of the book. The younger members of the cast have grown into their rolls and are all more convincing second time around. The special effects are good but the people are still the stars. Quite how they will replace dear departed Richard Harris I don't know as he excels again, but in every other way this augers well for the future films.
OK... this film is definitely worth seeing.  I don't need to say much about that.  Darker and better than the first.

I wasn't a fan of the first movie and actually shuddered at the fact that I had to see "Chamber of Secrets", but I was so pleasantly surprised.  So much better than the first in my opinion. Also, seeing Richard Harris, the one and only, in his final role, obviously laboring through, still performing as only he could.  Well worth it just for that.

Captures the spirit of the books.  The kids are great, the visual effects are great, it's not too scary for kids and I think the entire audience was in agreement that we wish it could have been longer.  I hope "Prisoner of Azkaban" is way longer, or at least a two-parter!

this movie was definatly 100 times better than the first, but the 2nd book is also twice as good as the first book, so what do you expect!  but aside from storyline, the actors have matured SO much, it's nuts, the first movie they look so young, you can tell they've aged very much since the beginning of filming of the sorcerers stone.  they also have gotten much better at acting, and playing their respective roles, especially daniel radcliffe and tom felton.  daniel(harry) fulfills his role of victor/defender/hero MUCH better in the 2nd film, he is truly a hero, and did an awesome job. and i just love tom felton, he has truly made draco the little devil he is, but i luv him neway! fans of all ages will surely enjoy this film, it is hilarious, GREAT comic relief, but also SCARY, i jumped a few times, and i'm 19 and i don't get scared easily( not saying this film scared me, but i was started and some things in it are just creepy! ) it's great, i say the target audience, which would enjoy and get the most out of this film is definatly those ages 13-25 who've read the books, and in addition adults of course!  but as for the younger crowd, well i don't think they can appreciate the books, and the myths/legends/facts jk rowling draws everything from, or the symbolism/foreshadowing etc. not to mention this movie is definatly scarier than potter #1   THIS GETS A BIG 10 FROM ME. GO READ THE BOOKS THO!!!!!!

Much better than the first movie, this 2:40 tome passes without much squirming on the part of the young ones. There are a few scary sequences during which your under-9 children might want to hold onto your arm but overall this movie moves right along with excellent visuals and tight acting. While the movie adheres rather strictly to Rowling, there is enough imaginative license to keep the adults amused while the kids enjoy it as well. Overall, this movie is the equivalent of tiramisu on the second day--much better mixing of ingredients and more subtle flavors. Enjoy.

I went and saw Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets today.  I was expecting a great movie and my expectations were fulfilled!  This movie is great!  After reading the book, the movie kept to the book and matched what I had imagined! It was very exciting and there was never a dull moment. The effects were better, too!  I noticed a huge improvement  This movie, unlike most sequels, was better than the first!

As a HUGE fan of the Harry Potter books I do not feel that this movie did the book justice.  I took my husband to see it, and spent the entire car ride home filling in all of the blanks for him. Once again, Hollywood has taken over and left the story by the wayside.  The exclusion of many characters left the story empty and undeveloped.  Taking away the History of Magic professor, who unwillingly told the story of the Chamber to the students in the book, left that task to Professor McGonagall.  This was totally out of character for her, as she would not want to frighten the students.  By lessening the part of Colin Creevy, and removing the girl who is later found to be Percey's girlfriend in the book, the film leaves out the feeling of the panic felt by the students in the book.  You don't feel their fear and uncertainty.  The film also leaves out Harry's isolation. The majority of the book is Harry's struggle with the whole school that had turned on him, which drives his desperation to find the real heir of Slytherin.  It also shrinks Ginny's part, as well as her crush on Harry. Without including how she was gushing about how wonderful Harry was in the journal, the film offers no explanation of how Tom Riddle grew to hate Harry and want him dead.  In the movie, Tom Riddle says that he took the name Voldermort because he would not keep his Muggle father's name.  That leaves the audience wondering how he could then be the heir of Slytherin.  It leaves out that Slytherin was from his mother's side and that his father left her when he found out that she was a witch.  But I must say the absolute most annoying part of the movie was the final scene, which had no part in the book where Hagrid returned and the entire room applauded.  It might have had more meaning had they bothered to include how half the school thought he was guilty, but either was it was pure Hollywood.  I do realize that in any film adaptation of a book things need to be left out, and I was even glad that many of the Lockhart scenes were excluded.  I just think that the overall story needs to be upheld so that the film can at least be understood for those who haven't read the book. All that aside, I still enjoyed watching the movie simply because I enjoy the characters so much.  For those of you who have not read the books, please to not judge them based on these movies.  Justice was not served.

This movie was amazing! Once again Rupert, Dan, and Emma did amazing jobs as the main characters. Gilderoy Lockhart made you laugh by just looking at him and moaning Myrtle was annoying and spooky just like she was supposed to be! The only thing we had negative to say about it was that they left out a few parts we felt were important and some parts of it were different than the book but didn't have to be. But ya know, it's HARRY POTTER!!!!! so it was amazing anyway! Go see it.

This movie to me was the BEST movie ever because I thought that this movie was going to seem sooooo long because it was approx. 2 hours and 45 minutes long!  To my surprise it wasn't long at all because the movie kept me interested at every single second... it's really sad that the person who played Albus Dumbledore died two weeks ago.... otherwise the movie was the best that it could be!  Everything looked so real I'd advise everyone to go see it!

This movie is amazing! Lots of action and suspense with just enough humor to keep you waiting on the edge of your seat for more. I cannot wait to see number three, and four, and five, and six, and so on and so forth! I love all of the characters and casting! Way to go cast, crew, and, audience! Loved it!!!

"Dobby has come to warn you sir."-A quote from this story which I found very suitable for this movie and something I say to you now as a fellow moviegoer. I found this movie to be utterly boring myself. I found too many transactions that could have had different connotations, most of which only adults would understand. This in itself was the only entertainment i got from this picture. Maybe i was looking for something other than a reproduction of a childrens story. Not having read any of the books in this series, I can only imagine that the people who have critiqued this film found excitement from finding if the director had different interpretations than themselves. One thing I did not like was the fact that the only bloodshed occured during the conclusion of this movie. I found it to be a rude awakening from the childish jokes. I thought it was humorous how all of the children thought it funny when Dobby started inflicting pain upon himself and I wondered what this was teaching them. I don't want to spend all night talking about this movie and I know one critical review wont stop you from seeing the movie, but if you decide to see Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, I recommend you pay the matinee price.

What can I say, other than I'm appalled that this film was ever released. Is it just a licence to print money for Warner Bros.? The film follows the same "predictable" format as the first one. Let me explain:-

This movie was a thousand times better than the first.  The kids in the cast clearly have matured a lot, and so have their acting skills.  It's got more of a plot, less introducing characters, and didn't get slow at any point in the movie.
First I would like to say that I felt the "Chamber of Secrets" was so much better than I had expected it to be.  If you haven't seen the movie yet, be warned.  There are going to be some spoilers.

I had been ignoring the Harry Potter phenomenon that seems to be sweeping the country - both in the child and adult world.  Previous to seeing this second installment I had not seen the first film, nor had I read any of the books.  I must say that after seeing Lord of the Rings on the Big Screen, I go to the cinema not expecting to even come close to having the same cinema experience.  But I have to say that Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets is the closest film to it so far.

Chamber of Secrets is an excellent movie. However, like the Sorcerer's Stone, it falls into the same assumption that you've read the book. However, this movie will not disappoint fans and Kenneth Branaugh as Gilderoy Lockeheart is hilarious!

I saw this movie and just want to say that it is awesome!! I loved it!! It is a bit off from the book and it is much different than i imagined it while reading, but they did and excellent job making the movie!! GO SEE IT IF U HAVEN'T ALREADY!!!

As someone who knows the books cover to cover, this movie wasn't as good as it could be, but it's certainly not bad either. It's quite entertaining, the acting is much better, and the fluidity of the books finally seems to be coming out. Although Professor McGonagall is too old, Flitwick doesn't have the same energy as he did in the book, Ron (Rupert Grint) seems somewhat unlike himself and the moving staircases were a kinky touch, Potter fans will appreciate it nonetheless. I look forward to the movie version of Prisoner of Azkaban (mostly because of Sirius and Lupin) as much as I do the fifth book (the Order of the Phoenix).

Many have said that sequels hardly ever surpass their originals. Though this is true, it is not the case with Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets.  In my opinion, this one was far better than the first. Don't get me wrong, i loved the first, but this one really was a lot better. What made this one better, i thought, were the special effects. In the first, they were good, but now they're amazing. In other movies where computer animation was used, you can tell that it isn't real.  However, in this movie, everything looks realistic. Anyway I truly recommend this movie to everyone. It really doesn't matter what age you are or if you are a Harry Potter fan. Trust me, it's worth the money!!

I watched this movie with my family and we loved it. It's great fun for all ages. It's scarier and funnier than the first. Also the actors themselves have evolved a lot into their characters. I loved it so much more then the first movie, lots more action and lots more mystery. Everything is a hundred times better. I'd say its the "Best movie Ever!" 10/10

This Harry Potter (I won't bother to explain the plot - you all know it) is simply amazing. It surpasses the first one by several wand-lengths. Daniel 'Harry' Radcliffe is his usual brilliant self, but it's obvious that Emma 'Hermione' Watson and Rupert 'Ron' Grint are more used to being on a filmset now. They are both great, but I'll have to admit that I like Rupert the most. The expression on his face when he meets the spiders! Tom 'Draco' Felton is also great, and so are, of course, all the adult actors in CoS too. This time it's scarier (I was dangerously close to wetting my pants a couple of times), darker and SO much better! The difference between the two books aren't nearly as huge as the difference between the two movies. It totally deserves to be the box office block buster it may (and WILL) become!

Of which the first one had. The first had been about discovery of this boy's true being and the way he handled it. This one, however, is a mystery movie, much more than SS was. The characters are older, taller, and slightly better actors from before, but that doesn't make up for how this film begins to draggggggg along middle-end of the movie.True to the book, but little things the peeved me off, like how arogog had tried to eat Harry, unlike the book where he had tried to attack harry until how he found out it was a friends of his masters. But I guess they needed a "Run like hell" sequence, so, whatever. I liked the ending where he had fought the Basilisk, but i never would've picture the snake to look more like a dragon. I give it 3 1/2 outta 5. That's good, right?

This film was a wonderful followup to the first year.  The characters stayed true to the book.  The effects were well integrated.  Most of the characters were well cast.  The only exception would be the choice for Gilderoy Lockhart.  Not that the Kenneth Branagh wasn't great, he just didn't fit the image I had in my head.  The other fans of the books and the movies made similar comments.

Okay, I am a huge HP fan...of the books. When I went to go see the first movie, i thought it was good, but i didnt like it as much as i thought i would. Now, when i went to go see the 2nd HP movie, you all can imagine that i thought it was going to be the same as the first. Choppy, mixed up and not that great. I prolly wouldnt have gone to see it, but my sister wanted to see it (shes 11) so i HAD to go take her to see it. I was so surprised to see that i liked this one! It had flow, more action, and it was just all around MUCH better than the first one! I even screamed at one point..i forget where...but i just got into this one. Well, that is my opinion.

As a huge fan of the books, it's a delight to see how closely both of the movies have followed them. "Chamber of Secrets" was exhilarating and enthralling from beginning to end. In fact, I was so engrossed that I didn't realize until I got out of the film and looked at my watch that it had been close to a three hour movie.
The movie was excellent regarding the adventure Harry had during his year of study, but I do find the underlying plot of the books to dropped out of the movie.

I found this film even better than the first. The action was immediate, and the effects superb. I thought the acting was brilliant, and I don't agree that the leading child actors are getting too old for the parts. Surely they should age with the characters portrayed? Overall, a superb film!

Having read all four of the Harry Potter Books I looked at this upcoming movie a little more critically. Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets did a fantastic job in bring the second year to life.  Chris Columbus the directed has been criticized for his focus on the special effects of the movie rather than the text of the movie overall.  I beg to differ.  Columbus's focus on special effects is one of the important things that brought this movie to life.  Bringing this book to life is no easy task and Chris Columbus has done an excellent job with his intense special effects. Daniel Radcliffe returns to play his famous role yet-Harry Potter. His two sidekicks Hermione Granger (Emma Watson) and Ron Weasley (Rupert Grint) embark on another adventure where they investigate the legend of the Chamber of Secrets.  Let's face it, these kids are Harry, Hermione, and Ron.  They prove time and again how magical these books and movies are.  Draco Malfoy (Tom Felton), Potter's enemy does an excellent job making the viewer hate him and his family.  A final bravo goes to the rest of the cast: Maggie Smith (Professor McGonagall), Robbie Coltrane (Hagrid), Alan Rickman (Professor Snape), Kenneth Branagh (Gilderoy Lockheart).  The faculty and staff of Hogwarts that keep the students in line and on their toes at all times.  Richard Harris who played Albus Dumbledore.  He did an excellent job portraying the lighthearted but strong Dumbledore.  Harris will forever live on in our hearts as the one and only Dumbledore.  Anyone who takes on this role will have their hands full.  He will forever be remembered and missed.

I notice that Harry Potter movies are getting "markdowns" because they dont totally fufill the book as everyone would like. I am one who agrees but think about it. You have 3 hours to make a movie that takes 2-5 days to read. You have to cut down a few scenes that arnt on plot. Most of the written words are how the characters look. So were getting it without realising it. This movie was funny, dramatic, heartwarming..Everything. It was a great movie. Movies arent ment to be word for word with a book..reading a book is fun..Watching it line for line isnt! Its fun to have changes, it makes the book more surprising to the readers of Harry Potter. Others say that it was "plotless". Book 2 is out of the Harry Potter book flow. We all know that. Book 5 is said to be the one that puts book 2 in the circle of books. It was more fast pace cause we know whos who and whats what. Get in the story and foucus most of the time on the big scenes. A childrens movie? Yes. A childrens book..NO! Im 16 and i have read the 4 books numerous times. I know older people who have to. Its more like a adults book that remind us about our childhood. Its on a childs level for them but its also on a higher lever for older people. Everyone of the actors did so well. Harry/Dan was so much more coragous. Hermione/Emma was a lot more forward and emotional. Ron/Rupert was just pure funny! Tom/Draco was much more malevolent and evil. Also with the other children/teen actors they did well. Every single one of them. The adult actors brought the tone and so wonderfully! Alan Rickman, Jason Isaccs, Richard Harris, Maggie Smith, and Kenneth Branagh, Robbie Coltrain, and Shirley Henderson all did outstanding. All of the cast, crew and members of this did so well. I enjoyed the effects. Next time hopfully Quittich will be longer. Sad to see Chris Columbus step down but Im trilled for "new blood" to direct and see what will happen. Prisoner of Azkaban is most likely gonna top the first two. I hope so atleast.This is more focused around Hogwarts so thats a good thing. We get more in class and Quittich. Also Alan Rickman..who everyone wants to see more of.

Saw the first twice. Liked it okay, but too mechanical. This has a much greater freedom and sense of fun to it. The young cast seems much more comfortable in their roles, especially Hermione Granger. The effects a great and the story moves along very well! I definitely recommend!!!

I thought Harry Potter was outstanding.I thought the first one was good but this was way better.I loved the spell fight.And anyone who dis liked it must have brain damage.Quidige was awesome.I am happy that Harry caught the snitch.But I think it should have been more like the book.And I think the snake was nasty.And the tree part couldn't have been cooler.You must go see it and lets pray that the new Dumbledoor is good because the last one kicked the bucket.We will send an owl to your house telling you to go see it.

Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets is the fast paced sequel in the Harry Potter series.  The young actors have matured in more ways than one, the older actors are still amazing, but what else is to be expected when teaming together Richard Harris (Prof. Dumbledore), Dame Maggie Smith (Prof. McGonagall), Alan Rickman (Prof. Snape) and Robbie Coltrane (Rubeus Hagrid). This movie is slightly darker than the first, but that's to be expected when there are disembodied voices and one gigantic snake.  The film introduced aspects such as new characters with a fluidity that if made like the first movie would have looked choppy and second rate.  This movie is absolutely fantastic and has me counting the days until the release of the third movie which will be the introduction of a new director and many new characters to the world of Harry Potter.

I have to say that I am bit picky when it comes to movies, but the latest in the "Harry Potter" series has REALLY done something. Yes, the first one was fabulous, and it served a specific purpose (as did the first book) in totally immersing the audience in the majesty and mystical qualities of Harry's world. However, the "Chamber of Secrets" is every bit as dark and intense as the book. I have read all 4 books, and I think that the attention to keeping the important aspects of the book in the movie are CLEARLY evident. The actors do a great job in being what they are....kids. They are just as I imagined when reading the books, and the lighting cues that were put into play this time around really showed the "dark" side of Harry's "gifts."

I have read lots of comments which include opinions that either the film is too long, or that the film misses out important parts of the plot.  Surely you cannot have both, as including the whole point would prolong the film's running time.

OH MY GOD! I LOVED THE MOVIE "Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone" but oh my GOD u got to believe me when i say the "Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets" is at least 100 times better!
