Why didn't I feel as thrilled as when I watched the first movie? I actually felt a little bit disappointed. I think it has some problems. And the most of it has to do with the rythm of the movie. What I really liked with the first movie was rythm in it. The way it was cut and told was in fact - excellent! The way the characters were introduced, the way of telling the story with the camera which sometime really rested on the pictures. If it was a children's movie or not has nothing to do with if it was good or bad. It was indeed a really excellent handicraft. But this movie lacks the balance of the first one. Even if it is long, I actually think the movie would have been better if they made it even longer! Why? - The story and the characters are not introduced properly. The editing is faster then that in the first one and details which could have been exciting or funny gets lost or actually even destroyed because of this. It feels like that they could have done so much more with everything. In this movie I have no feeling for the characters. Not for the new ones nor even the old ones. Only a stupid owl and a Phoenix gets my sympathy. they were indeed the best with this movie!

I think that this film is much better than the first one in many ways: The pacing, the acting, the humour, etc... Although it still wasn't brilliant. It has the ability to be brilliant but it doesn't manage it. The book still beats it easily.

I thought this movie was very well done. I'm not in a position to offer an educated critique, just giving an opinion as a movie-goer. The movie very closely follows the book, and I was enchanted by the whole thing, particularly the great musical score. Oh sure, there are parts that need to be cut or shortened up, but as the overall story goes, it was great fun. I for one go to a movie to be entertained, not to sit and pull the thing apart afterward. I was entertained, I was able to escape into a completely different realm for a short while, and I enjoyed it immensely.

It's difficult to watch a movie after reading the book without prejudice or bias, so with great trepidation and anticipation I took my family to see the second Harry Potter movie. I loved it! I know it's difficult to include everything in a movie and although I missed a lot of things in the movie, like the denogming and Percy's girlfriend sub-plot, their lack of appearance in the movie didn't take away from the movie plot at all.

The same successful formula used in the first Harry Potter film is repeated once more in this one. The story drags on quite a bit, but I guess the children like the small off-topic spin-offs in the movie. Overall I liked the film, but at least an hour could easily be cut out to make it better.
RATING: 10 out of 10

Strong points: marvellous rendition of Dobby, the computer-generated house elf; delightful portrayal of the Weasley household with Julie Walters as Molly (enjoy it while it lasts, because it's one of the few funny scenes in this long film); wonderful cameo appearance by Miriam Margoyles as Professor Sprout the Herbologist, using humanoid mandrake plants as a prop. Weak points: too long and sometimes slow-moving; poor direction of Rupert Grint, who spends too much time squeaking and looking terrified; hopelessly wooden acting of Christian Coulson as Tom Marvolo Riddle; disappointing and unconvincing climax. The noise level is generally high (sometimes excruciatingly so), yet some of the diction of the actors is not altogether clear. Not as good as the first Harry Potter film in my view, but worth seeing nevertheless. Marks: five out of ten.

This movie continues the excellent standard set in the first movie. The special effects are outstanding and the characters continue to be exciting and interesting.  The young actors continue their great performance bringing each character to life with riviting performances. Each has their own special quality that makes their character portrayal their own.  It is an all-around outstanding movie with great special effects, beautiful scenery, and wonderful storyline. I look forward to the next one.  Have watched this one about fifteen times.

This book pulled more interest to me then others did. This is the only Harry Potter book i have fully read before watching the move. The fact that Harry is still younger and he is still figuring this whole wizard thing out is absolutely amazing. I would recommend this book for anyone over the age of 8, for it's full of exciting adventure and scary situations that only one wizard could over come. I have learned something from this book also its that no matter how hard something is as long as you stay brave and trust yourself to do the right thing

hi, im such a big, i mean BIG, fan of harry potter!!! harry potter and the chamber of secrets is the best movie of the year ( or more, if it was out earlyer ). i cant wait 't'll the 3rd movie, it is very exciting, even if i only read the book. i cant wait one more year!!!

I really liked the Harry Potter books and Chamber of Secrets was (is) my second favorite. As such, I had great expectations towards the movie versions, and while they did a good job in recreating the world Ms. Rowling had created, they still had their shorcomigs, especially the second one.

Harry Potter is an English schoolboy who wears trademarked and copyrighted glasses. He goes to school in a school of magic. Which is quite a change from the usual English school boy drama (viz. David Copperfield). Unfortunately, Harry has enough gruel. However, conflicts come about because Harry and his pals are the good kind of Satan-worshippers, and they fight against the bad kind of Satan-worshippers. Anyway, Harry lives in this castle where he goes to school with a large group of English character actors. Some of them wear fake beards or wigs.

Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone explained the difference between the magical world of wizards and the non-magical world of muggles.  Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets clearly spells out the racial lines between purebloods and mudbloods, witches or wizards with muggle ancestors, and has a darker theme that emphasizes the evils of racism.  In this installment Harry (played by Daniel Radcliffe), Ron (played by Rupert Grint), and Hermione (played by Emma Watson) must fight to stop the genocide of the mudbloods. In Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, Ron, accompanied by two of his brothers, free Harry from his aunt and uncle's home where he is being held. Soon after the students return to Hogwarts something begins attacking mudbloods and Harry begins hearing voices.  Harry, Ron, and Hermione then set into motion a plan to find the Chamber of Secrets and try to destroy the monster before any mudbloods are injured. There are a number of similarities between the Chamber of Secrets and Lord of the Rings the Two Towers.  The most notable similarity is the underlying theme of racism.  Other similarities include the fight between good and evil and the use of magic.  In the Lord of the Rings each of the races believes its race to be superior and orc race trying to eradicate all of the other races. Chris Columbus directed both Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets and the first installment Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone.  Columbus really sets the stage with the appropriate use of high contrast, low key, and three-point lighting.  Light and dark have very symbolic meaning and without correct use the movie would have lost much of its ambiance. It is very important in today's society that children learn about racism and the effects it has on others.  While education at home and at school are extremely effective tools in eradicating racism we should grasp all opportunities to teach this lesson.  Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets is able to connect with children and addresses this issue without pressure.

computer animation lovers will definitely fall in love with this movie as the animation is some of the best ever (minus Lord of the Rings movies). HP lovers are in for a treat as this movie brings to life the characters in the best way (perfect guy for Lockhart, he really seemed conceited). better than the first film and and a much better understanding of wizards and the life at Hogwarts. like i said, a MUST SEE MOVIE for everyone.

The SFX were impressive, especially the character of Dobby. He was well great. I couldn't tell he was CG by his bad creation, but through the fact there was no way they could have done it otherwise. In fact the CG character of Dobby is very similar looking to Gollum in Lord of The Rings and the CG Asgard in television series Stargate SG-1 (speaking of textures) which which speaks well for Stargate SG-1 if it can do just as good as a top movie like this...and top it is. The CG Spiders were incredibly creepy and realistic looking. Not being too scared of Spiders, they kind of made me jump. I felt by body tense up as the gave case to Harry and Ron, which is a good thing because not often do I find myself doing this in movies. The person I had sat beside seemed pretty scared of the spiders as well.

i agree and really i think we see the movie that way is because we've already read the books and after that are expecting something like it when you see the movie. when u see the first movie its good then u read the book and its better than the book but if u read the book first u expect a lot of things out of the movie that wont deliver... and w/ the bad acting...not trying to stick up for them ne thing (but i do love the characters) but remember the people who casted them got the people best picked for the parts so...it could have always been worst. i also believe that as these kids do more or the movies their acting skills will get better, this is some of the kids first movies so it would be unfair of us to expect Oscar award winning acting u kno? i already think the actings gotten better since movie #1.

There is a rule which say that a sequel is always going to be worse than the first film. But with Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets and Lord of The Rings: The Two Towers it is shown that a sequel can be equally good or even better than the first film.

A typical Harry Potter film, with stunning performances from: Danial Radclif as Harry Potter, Rupert Gritt as Ron Weasely, and the perfectly G-O-R-G-E-O-U-0-S-E , Emma Watson as Hermione Granger(her parents are the G-R-E-A-T-E-S-T artists E-V-E-R!!!!!!!!). And of course I cant forget to mention the marvelouse Richard Harris as Hogwarts Head Marster, Albus Dumbledor, and it was an extreme tragedy when Richard Harris died a little while after the release of 'Chamber of Seacrets' on to DVD and VHS. i think it is safe to say that Richard Harris made the character Albus Dumbledor what he is today. As a fan i can say honestly that, like other fans i await the release of the rest of the Harry Potter books on to the big screen, however I don't know how thay will replace the awesome talent of Richard Harris, but they will shurly be great films none the less. Thank you for reading my review on the movie 'Harry Potter and the Chamber of Seacrets'
Chamber of Secrets is a bit darker than Philosopher's Stone (UK)/Sorcerer's Stone (US), and Daniel Radcliffe's acting had improved this time round (he was a little wooden in the first film).

The one main reason why I like this movie is : It is exciting, and keeps me nervous all the time. During the part in which Harry fights with Riddle, at first Harry is beaten by the curse & I really think that Harry would die. However, with the help of the Phoneix which is sent by Dumbledore, Harry finally can escape from the attack and be safe. In addition, the music, the vivid acting of characters, it all makes me thrill and as if I were in the scene, witnessing the whole incident. I think the music is well written and digital sound effect in the theatre is astonishing. I can still hear all the sound effects even when I am sleeping. Besides, the story fulfills the spirit and the ideal of youngsters: fight against the enemy and having mysterious adventure. I learnt that we have to be brave when we are in tough situation. Furthermore, we need to have confidence for ourselves and at last the good guy can beat the evil. Though we can see such plot and philosophy in other movies, but I am truly touched in this particular one. The story seems to be a mystery when people become petrified one by one. However, with Harry at the most important role, he solves the mystery by himself and fights against Lord Voldemort. Finally he wins and there comes a happy ending. I think throughout the whole movie, the acting of characters, the music, the set-up and the storyline all reach a satisfactory standard for audience.

If you thought the first movie was good than you will think this one is great. This is a great family movie. Both adults and children can follow this move with ease. This movie is not just another child's cartoon with unbelievable monsters like "Monsters Inc."; it is well-developed movie with great special effects. I personal have not read the book, but now after seeing this movie, it makes me want to read the whole series starting with the first one. My favorite character in this film was Dobby the mischief elf; he is mysteriously great in this film. It was apparent to me that Harry Potters (played by Daniel Radcliffe), Ron Weasley (played by Rupert Grint), and Hermione Granger (played by Emma Watson) has settled comfortably into their roles.
